Subject: Invitation to Join "Smart Money Moves" – Episode on Financial Literacy for College Students

Hi Jordan,

I’m Alex Rivera, host of the "Smart Money Moves" podcast where we help listeners make smarter financial decisions. I’ve been following FinLit Labs and especially love the way your "College Cashflow" podcast and Instagram series break down budgeting, credit, and investing for college‑aged audiences.

We’re planning an upcoming episode titled **“Financial Literacy for College Students: Smart Budgeting, Credit, and Investing.”** Given your expertise in teaching personal finance to students and your strong connection with the 18‑24 demographic, I think you’d be an incredible guest to share actionable tips with our listeners.

The episode would be a relaxed 45‑minute conversation recorded remotely at a time that works for you. We’d love to discuss:
- Practical budgeting hacks for students living on a tight budget
- How to build and maintain a good credit score while in college
- Introductory investing strategies that fit a student’s risk profile

Our audience consists largely of college students (70% under 25) who are eager for real‑world advice they can apply immediately. I’m confident your insights would resonate deeply.

Would you be interested in joining us? I’m happy to work around your schedule and can provide any additional details you need.

Thank you for considering the invitation – I look forward to the possibility of collaborating!

Best regards,
Alex Rivera
Host, Smart Money Moves
alex@smartmoneymoves.com
@AlexRiveraPod

Here’s the finished email pitch for Jordan Lee. You can copy‑paste it into your email client and send it at your convenience.

Let me know if you’d like any tweaks, or if you’d prefer to reach out to a different candidate.
